response.overview: Meet the largest carnivore on Earth: the great Kodiak bear. Travel to Alaska's Kodiak Island where 4,000-foot mountains rise up along hundreds of miles of jagged coastline.  Hike these ancient feeding trails where bears as big as 1,500 pounds gorge on berries and roll down salmon-rich rivers past cubs learning to fish. Renowned wildlife filmmaker Wolfgang Bayer even takes you inside a den.  Plus, witness dramatic home videos of dangerous tourist encounters with these amazing animals in Giant bears of Kodiak Island.
response.title: Giant Bears of Kodiak Island
